availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas W Redmon (Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary A. "Polly" Redmon. Father to Squire Redmon, William H. Redmon, Sarah A. Redmon, John Redmon, and Minerva Redmon. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned two enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1840. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 273.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 58B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 216.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 75A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Camargo, p. 241B.
